title: Ticket #3648: look into different upgrade scenarios for condor rpm
description:
Depending on the scenario, an administrator may want the condor service to stop immediately (ie, not hang), or to wait for jobs to finish, etc.

When is it appropriate to do condor_off -fast vs -graceful vs -peaceful? Can we make the upgrade process deal with more than one type of scenario? (maybe depending on config file settings?)

How is a (potentially large) active pool upgraded? What does the upgrade look like from each of the node types? (Fermi has reported upgrades being a pain on the execute nodes.) Do things work when a large active pool is in progress upgrading? Etc.

Look into potential issues related to different upgrade scenarios and see if there is a way to handle them reasonably.
remarks: Currently, the mechanism for HTCondor to automatically detect upgrades is used, which seems to cover the most general cases and at a minimum covers what the other RPMs are doing. This may be good enough. For now we just want to make sure nothing breaks when upgrading from the previous rpms.
